title: background error: invalid internal key kind: 128 & background error: pebble/table: invalid table 006205
body:
#### System information

Geth version: v1.12.2
CL client & version:  lighthouse v4.3.0
OS & Version: Ubuntu 22.04, 6.2.0-31-generic
Commit hash : nil

#### Expected behaviour

Sync from clean or non-existent db 

#### Actual behaviour

Behaviour happens on both geth instances on Mainnet and Sepolia sync from scratch, after some time (within 1 hour)

Mainnet Geth:
```
INFO [09-05|08:37:17.972] Syncing: chain download in progress      synced=0.36% chain=22.91MiB headers=102,400@18.84MiB bodies=65397@3.21MiB receipts=65397@882.27KiB eta=1h15m37.887s
INFO [09-05|08:37:18.197] Syncing: state download in progress      synced=0.12% state=287.04MiB accounts=258,485@61.47MiB slots=1,027,439@205.68MiB codes=7838@19.89MiB eta=3h53m32.309s
2023/09/05 08:37:23 background error: pebble/table: invalid table 006205 (checksum mismatch at 1960769/3872)
```

After restart:

```
INFO [09-05|08:23:18.169] Syncing: state download in progress      synced=14.85% state=2.45GiB   accounts=2,143,718@546.01MiB slots=9,078,258@1.72GiB   codes=32298@202.03MiB eta=19m21.036s
2023/09/05 08:23:23 background error: pebble/table: invalid table 017558 (checksum mismatch at 1546955/4053)

2023/09/05 08:23:23 background error: pebble/table: invalid table 017558 (checksum mismatch at 1546955/4053)
2023/09/05 08:23:23 background error: pebble/table: invalid table 017558 (checksum mismatch at 1546955/4053)

```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Start script for Mainnet geth instance:
```
/mnt/data2/Execution_Clients/Go_Ethereum/binaries/v1_12_2/geth --mainnet \
 --datadir /mnt/data2/data/mainnet/geth \
 --port=30303 \
 --authrpc.addr="0.0.0.0" \
 --authrpc.port=8551 \
 --authrpc.vhosts="0.0.0.0" \
 --authrpc.jwtsecret=/mnt/data2/secrets/jwtsecret \
 --http \
 --http.port=8545 \
 --http.addr="0.0.0.0" \
 --http.api="eth,debug,net,txpool,web3" \
 --ws \
 --ws.addr=0.0.0.0 \
 --ws.origins=* \
 --ws.port=8546 \
 --ws.api="engine,eth,net,web3,admin,debug,personal,miner,txpool"
```



Start script for Sepolia geth instance:
```
/mnt/data2/Execution_Clients/Go_Ethereum/binaries/v1_12_2/geth --sepolia \
 --datadir /mnt/data3/data/sepolia/geth \
 --port=30304 \
 --authrpc.addr="0.0.0.0" \
 --authrpc.port=8552 \
 --authrpc.vhosts="0.0.0.0" \
 --authrpc.jwtsecret=/mnt/data3/secrets3/jwtsecret \
 --http \
 --http.port=8547 \
 --http.addr="0.0.0.0" \
 --http.api="eth,debug,net,txpool,web3" \
 --ws \
 --ws.addr=0.0.0.0 \
 --ws.origins=* \
 --ws.port=8548 \
 --ws.api="engine,eth,net,web3,admin,debug,personal,miner,txpool"

```



#### Backtrace

nil
Is there any error on your disks, you can check with tools like `dmesg`

No errors showing on disks with `dmesg`, they are also brand new disks so i wouldn't expect any hardware errors. I'm attempting a sync with v1.12.0 from a clean database path now. Will report if i get the same issue within an hour or so.

Same issue on geth v1.12.0 after about 1 hr

```
INFO [09-05|08:37:17.972] Syncing: chain download in progress      synced=0.36% chain=22.91MiB headers=102,400@18.84MiB bodies=65397@3.21MiB receipts=65397@882.27KiB eta=1h15m37.887s
INFO [09-05|08:37:18.197] Syncing: state download in progress      synced=0.12% state=287.04MiB accounts=258,485@61.47MiB slots=1,027,439@205.68MiB codes=7838@19.89MiB eta=3h53m32.309s
2023/09/05 08:37:23 background error: pebble/table: invalid table 006205 (checksum mismatch at 1960769/3872)
2023/09/05 08:37:23 background error: pebble/table: invalid table 006205 (checksum mismatch at 1960769/3872)
2023/09/05 08:37:23 background error: pebble/table: invalid table 006205 (checksum mismatch at 1960769/3872)
2023/09/05 08:37:23 background error: pebble/table: invalid table 006205 (checksum mismatch at 1960769/3872)
2023/09/05 08:37:23 background error: pebble/table: invalid table 006205 (checksum mismatch at 1960769/3872)
2023/09/05 08:37:24 background error: pebble/table: invalid table 006205 (checksum mismatch at 1960769/3872)
2023/09/05 08:37:24 background error: pebble/table: invalid table 006205 (checksum mismatch at 1960769/3872)
```

> they are also brand new disks so i wouldn't expect any hardware errors

Well, let's check it. It seems suspicious that you hit data corruption twice in such short span of time.  `dmesg` just shows messages, could you try something that actively diagnoses the disk? Such as `fsck` or  `smartctl`. 


Also, you have mounted the datadir as `/mnt/data2/data/mainnet/geth` -- could you tell us a bit about that mount -- what type of filesystem is it (both the home and the mount), and what type of disks are they?

If this is consumer RAM, not ECC, please make a memtest86+ boot USB, boot from that, and let it run for 5 days (no really) or until you see errors, whichever comes first. Consumer RAM errors are a little tedious to track down and can cause this kind of corruption.
Which filesystem are you using, ext4 or xfs, and the hardware spec of your machine(CPU, memory, SSD HDD, or nvme)? I'm trying to reproduce it.
And in the meantime, can you help to test geth with `--db.engine=leveldb`, to check if this is a pebble's error or hardware's.
